name: Radisson Blu Edwardian Manchester

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 1 night in July 2007. We arranged concierge parking (£20) in advance. Upon arrival we drove up to the front of the hotel where the concierge was waiting. This saved lots of time and is very good value for money as to park in the same car park independently was around £15, plus we left our car in there for the whole of the next day too at no extra cost.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

likes.liked: — AConcierge parking, use or pool and steam room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was v. modern and clean. Spa and steam room facilities were excellent.
reviews.title: Great 5***** hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only poor service was at the bar, which was busy and under staffed. After 15 mins of waiting to be served we left and went elsewhere.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast was a large selection and good quality.
reviews.title: A really great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: There are other hotels available for less, but overall the quality in all aspects of the hotel and the concierge service was worth paying for.
reviews.title: Good but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Never again.....expect hundreds of pounds to be frozen in your bank account(£450) and not be informed of this at the beginning of your stay! And then pay your bill at the end(£258) on top of the frozen monies which will be released 3-5 working days after you have left!Apparently this is standard practice for a '5' star stay at the Radisson Edwardian.
reviews.title: Very disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The stress and hassle this caused was unbelievable..!
reviews.title: Very Disappointing For a 5 star Hotel

likes.disliked: — Value for money, as not a 5 star experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: My girlfriend had booked this hotel as a surprise birthday present to celebrate my 30th birthday. She specifically chose this hotel based on it being a "5 Star" hotel with the Wow factor!
reviews.title: Great location, lovely hotel

likes.liked: — The lovely rooms and great views over Manchester
likes.disliked: — The small things that were missing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Imagine our disappointment on arrival to be told we were not staying in a deluxe double but a twin room as no other rooms were available!!
reviews.title: a bit disappointing...

likes.liked: — staff were excellent, bedroom was very clean
likes.disliked: — spa changing room disgraceful, room decor ugly and dated, various problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were further disappointed on opening the door to what can only be described as a very average twin room (rather than a 5 star double deluxe which was apx £200 for the night)
reviews.title: Mean with the soap !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Radisson Edwardian once again Sunday 23rd March for one night and this hotel never dissapoint's us. The cleanliness is second to non, the staff are always exceptional and are so helpful with any requests you may have.
reviews.title: Once Again This Superb Hotel Does Not Dissapoint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: This is by far our favourite hotel in Manchester and we have stayed at many.
reviews.title: Expensive but very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: The bar is super classy, the rooms are always lovely, they have the most comfortable beds ever and the bathrooms are lovely. I especially like the large bottles of toiletries which I have only ever seen in this hotel as normally there is never enough in little bottles.
reviews.title: Really nice hotel, quite pricey though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was superb with plenty of choice from pastries, cereals, toast to a traditional english breakfast and every kind of egg imaginable.
reviews.title: Good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say this is a truly remarkable hotel and fully deserves its 5Stars.
reviews.title: Pity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just come back from a one night stay at the Radisson Edwardian. The hotel is extremely classy and this is evident from the minute you walk through the door to be greeted by a contrasting but well worked style of old meets new. Front reception were extremely efficient and helpful, giving an impression that they actually enjoy their jobs. In fact, all the Radisson staff seemed happy and genuinely wanted to help wherever they could. Nothing was ever a task too far for them. This I feel, is lacking from many hotels nowadays.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but definately 5* prices!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The journey from reception to your room is a pleasant one. A ride up a beautifully mirrored lift takes you to your floor. Once you step out, you have an amazing view over Manchester through floor to ceiling glass. The rooms themselves are immaculate and tastefully decorated. The wet room is a nice touch.
reviews.title: Very nice modern, stylish hotel with great architecture

likes.disliked: — food could be a little better, but not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: A trip to Opus One restaurant brings you back down to Earth a little. We didn't eat in there because it was fully booked but looking at the menu, we weren't disappointed. The service here can be slow at times and a little abrupt. If you're feeling in the mood for a cocktail, like I was, be prepared to take out a bank loan for a round of drinks! Yes I know 5* hotels are expensive but some of the drinks prices were ridiculous. It was also extremely dark inside and felt a little uninviting. Breakfast in the morning was up to usual Radisson standards and the breakfast staff were efficient but it all felt a little rushed.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007
reviews.text: Overall, the hotel is stylish and the staff very friendly. But for the price of a room coupled with the price of food, drinks etc I think you could get better value. I have stayed at the 5* Hilton in the Beetham Tower and price-for-price this is a better option. Yes, that's expensive too but at least there you have the novelty of the amazing views. This is my preferred choice in future.
reviews.title: Never ever again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, the Radisson is a very good hotel but expensive for what you get.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay - Best so far in Manchester

description: The award-winning Radisson Blu Edwardian Free Trade Hall Manchester features 263 bedrooms, in addition to a number of meeting and event rooms, within a luxury 5* gold award property. The hotel also caters to your every culinary need, from Steak & Lobster at Alto, to the glamorous Opus One Restaurant and Bar featuring the finest locally sourced British food. Sienna Spa & Health Club comes complete with swimming pool, Jacuzzi and steam/sauna. The hotel holds the Green Tourism Business Scheme Gold Award. Throughout the hotel is complimentary Wi-Fi.
